instruction: Explain AMD GPUs to a 10 year old
output: AMD GPUs are special computer chips that help make games look really pretty and run smoothly! Think of them like super-fast artists that can draw thousands of pictures every second. They're made by a company called AMD, and they compete with another company called NVIDIA to make the best graphics cards.

ROCm (Radeon Open Compute) is AMD's open-source software platform for GPU computing. It allows developers to run high-performance computing applications on AMD GPUs, similar to how CUDA works for NVIDIA GPUs.

LoRA (Low-Rank Adaptation) is an efficient fine-tuning method that adds small trainable matrices to existing model layers instead of updating all parameters. This dramatically reduces memory usage and training time while maintaining performance.
